subdisciplines.name: Mucosal Immunology
subdisciplines.description: The study of the immune system in mucosal tissues, such as the respiratory, gastrointestinal, and urogenital tracts.

subdisciplines.name: Vaccinology
subdisciplines.description: The study of how vaccines work, including the development of new vaccines and the improvement of existing ones.

subdisciplines.name: Immunotherapy
subdisciplines.description: The use of the body's immune system to treat diseases, including cancer and autoimmune disorders.

subdisciplines.name: Immunogenetics
subdisciplines.description: The study of the genetic basis of the immune system and its interactions with other genetic systems.

subdisciplines.name: Tumor Immunology
subdisciplines.description: The study of the immune response to cancer, including the development of new cancer treatments that target the immune system.
